byline.contributor: Jad Mouawad contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and JAD MOUAWAD

abstract: Environmental Protection Agency prepares to report that greenhouse gas emissions from airplanes endanger human health because they significantly contribute to global warming; so-called 'endangerment finding' will prompt requirement under Clean Air Act for agency to issue new regulations, joining string of new rules that have become hallmark of Pres Obama's environmental legacy.
lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency is expected to report as early as Friday that greenhouse gas emissions from airplanes endanger human health through global warming.

headline.main: E.P.A. to Set New Limits on Airplane Emissions
headline.print_headline: E.P.A. to Set New Limits on Airplane Emissions

snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency is expected to report as early as Friday that greenhouse gas emissions from airplanes endanger human health through global warming.

keywords.value: National Assn of Clean Air Agencies
